meanings.definition: A group of people gathered together for a common purpose.
meanings.sent1: During the school assemblies, students listened to important announcements.
meanings.sent2: The town hall assemblies were held to discuss community issues.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion assemblies, everyone tried to outdo each other with stories.
meanings.sent4: The assemblies of birds on the power lines resembled a musical score.
meanings.sent5: The assemblies of colorful balloons made the party venue look festive.

meanings.definition: The action of gathering together as a group.
meanings.sent1: The assemblies of protesters marched peacefully down the street.
meanings.sent2: The assemblies of fans cheered loudly at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The assemblies of clouds in the sky seemed to form funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: The assemblies of ants working together impressed the observers.
meanings.sent5: The assemblies of students waiting for the bus chatted excitedly.

meanings.definition: The act of fitting together the parts of a machine or structure.
meanings.sent1: The assemblies of the toy car were done carefully to avoid mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The assemblies of the puzzle pieces took longer than expected.
meanings.sent3: The assemblies of Lego blocks sometimes resulted in creative inventions.
meanings.sent4: The assemblies of gears in the clock made a satisfying clicking sound.
meanings.sent5: The assemblies of furniture required following the instructions step by step.
